Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. The number 22 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd and on a paper label glued to the interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1444) (phase 2)
